channel.title: Environmental settings
channel.description: Ok I have nothing in my path or classpath at the moment. And i have jdk and jde downloaded. WIndows vista. Can somebody please tell me what do put in the class and classpath or how to get clients to work pleeeeeaaaaaaseeeee

item.title: Environmental settings
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Both rocket science and computer science aren’t that complicated.

In computer science you simply manipulate information, thats it. All the server does is take in information from the client and then generate more information, and the information the client generates comes from our input.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: Environmental settings
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

Modern warfa:

LOl I am amazed by this communities hospitality to welcome new members striving to learn about servers. Besides the tutorial in server tutorials is what screwed my settings up.

You probably didn’t follow it correctly then. For example, you may have specified the wrong Java version in the path. If you download version 6_17, and the tutorial was made when 6_15 was out, you have to change the 6_15 in the tutorial to 6_17. Its not rocket science.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental settings
item.dc:creator: @Mod_Brandon12111 Mod Brandon12111
item.description:
@Mod_Brandon12111 wrote:

Well maybe you should learn Java coding a little more or re-read the tutorial and if that doesn’t work there’s 100’s of more.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental settings
item.dc:creator: @Modern_warfa Modern warfa
item.description:

LOl I am amazed by this communities hospitality to welcome new members striving to learn about servers. Besides the tutorial in server tutorials is what screwed my settings up.

HOW do i check the version of JDK, I looked in my java folder but only jre is in there. I know i have jdk downloaded.

Read full topic

[/quote]

Or maybe someone can help him…[/quote]
This is helping him to utilize the search button. So at least he would learn something instead of being spoonfed.

Read full topic

item.title: Environmental settings
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

Name:CLASSPATH
Value:

CLASSPATH=C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;%CLASSPATH%;
And

Name:PATH
Value:

C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_VERSION\bin;
If JDK is installed in Program Files (x86) Than change that, and also change VERSION to your Jdk update version.

Mod Brandon12111:

I suggest you go to the Server Tutorial section.

Or maybe someone can help him…

Read full topic
